In this thrilling film, Russell Crowe plays a professional negotiator trying to rescue his engineer wife's husband from guerrillas in South America. It offers an exciting adventure with strong characters that might appeal to your taste for literature-based stories.

Alternatively, if you're interested in something a bit more unique and less serious, "The Return of the Living Dead" could be a fun choice! This classic horror comedy involves zombies rising due to a mysterious gas leak at a medical supply warehouse. With memorable performances from actors like Clu Gulager and Linnea Quigley, it's sure to keep you entertained.

Given that you were expecting a different vibe from 'Aladdin' and you seem to enjoy literature, I'd like to recommend "Little Women" (1868). This classic tale, based on Louisa May Alcott's novel, follows the lives of four sisters growing up in post-Civil War America. It's a heartwarming story that is both timeless and engaging.

If you're looking for something more modern with a hint of comedy, "American Dreamz" (2006) might be worth checking out. This film features an all-star cast, including Chris Klein, Dennis Quaid, and Willem Dafoe, and is about the strange intersection between reality TV and politics. It's definitely a unique take on contemporary society!

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text: One film that might resonate with you, given your interest in deeper stories and war genre, is "War Horse". Based on Michael Morpurgo's novel, this moving tale takes audiences on an extraordinary journey from the fields of rural Devon to the trenches of World War I France. David Thewlis, Jeremy Irvine, and Eddie Marsan are among its talented cast members. Another intriguing option is "The Prestige," a suspenseful tale about two stage magicians in 1890s London who engage in a battle to create the ultimate illusion while sacrificing everything they have to outwit each other. Stars like Hugh Jackman, Christian Bale, and David Bowie add to its allure. Enjoy either of these captivating films!
